Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the bats pictured on the U.S. quarter issued in 2020 are Samoan fruit bats, which have no known connection to COVID-19.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the bats pictured on the quarter by suggesting they indicate a government plot connected to COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to establish a connection between the bats on the quarter and a government plot related to COVID-19.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the bats pictured on the quarter are somehow linked to COVID-19, without providing any evidence or basis for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the bats pictured on the quarter are simply a representation of the National Park of American Samoa, with no connection to COVID-19.
